edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree

Class GeneralTree<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc316.hr.tree.GeneralTree<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the generic element type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tree<E>

    public class GeneralTree<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tree<E>
    Class that represents the general tree data structure, which uses the linked representation as the underlying data structure.
    Author:
    Jimmy Nguyen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  GeneralTree.Node
      The inner class of the GeneralTree class that stores the key, element, a reference to the parent node, and a collection of child nodes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeneralTree()
      Constructor that creates an empty general tree, initializes the root field to null, and initializes the size field to 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneralTree

        public GeneralTree()
        Constructor that creates an empty general tree, initializes the root field to null, and initializes the size field to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • getElement

        public E getElement(GeneralTree.Node node)
        Returns the element stored in the tree node. If the given node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown. Note that the idea of using a getElement method is referenced from page 312 of the Data Structures & Algorithm textbook by Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to retrieve the element from
        Returns:
        the element stored in the tree node
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given node is null

      • getKey

        public java.lang.String getKey(GeneralTree.Node node)
        Returns the key stored in the tree node. If the given node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to retrieve the key from
        Returns:
        the key stored in the tree node
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given node is null

      • root

        public GeneralTree.Node root()
        Returns the root node of the general tree.
        Returns:
        the root node of the general tree

      • parent

        public GeneralTree.Node parent(GeneralTree.Node node)
        Returns the parent node of the given node. If the given node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to find the parent for
        Returns:
        the parent node of the given node
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given node is null

      • numChildren

        public int numChildren(GeneralTree.Node node)
        Returns the number of children nodes that the given parent node has. If the given node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to retrieve the number of children nodes
        Returns:
        the number of children nodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given node is null

      • getChildren

        public ArrayBasedList<GeneralTree.Node> getChildren(GeneralTree.Node node)
        Returns the collection of children nodes that the given parent node has. If the given node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to obtain the collection of children nodes from
        Returns:
        the collection of children nodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given node is null

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String k,
                   E e)
        Adds an element and its corresponding key to the tree. If the given key or element is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown
        Specified by:
        insert in interface Tree<E>
        Parameters:
        k - the key to add to the tree
        e - the element to add to the tree
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key or element is null

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String k,
                   E e,
                   GeneralTree.Node pn)
        Adds an element and its corresponding key to a new node and connects the new node with the given parent node from the tree. If the given key/element or parent node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown. If the parent node is null, but the root is null, then the reference to the root node is updated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to add to the new node
        e - the element to add to the new node
        pn - the parent node to connect with the newly created node
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key/element or parent node is null

      • remove

        public E remove(java.lang.String k)
        Removes and returns an element from the tree, given a key. Note that the general tree does not have a defined natural ordering, so the remove method will thus be left unimplemented. If the tree is empty, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the given key is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface Tree<E>
        Parameters:
        k - the key to remove the element from
        Returns:
        the removed element or null if there are no elements to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the tree is empty
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key is null

      • remove

        public E remove(java.lang.String k,
                GeneralTree.Node node)
        Removes and returns an element from the given node in the tree, given a key. If the tree is empty, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the given key or node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to remove the element from
        node - the current node to remove the element and key from
        Returns:
        the removed element or null if there are no elements to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the tree is empty
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key or node is null

      • setElement

        public E setElement(java.lang.String k,
                    E e,
                    GeneralTree.Node node)
        Sets the element of the given node to the given element and key. Returns the element that was replaced. If the given key/element to set or the given node is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown. If the general tree is empty, then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        k - the key to set to the given node
        e - the element to set to the given node
        node - the node to set the element to
        Returns:
        the element that was replaced
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given key/element to set or node is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the general tree is empty

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of the general tree.
        Specified by:
        size in interface Tree<E>
        Returns:
        the size of the general tree

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determines if the general tree is empty. Returns true if the general tree is empty or false otherwise.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface Tree<E>
        Returns:
        true if the tree is empty or false otherwise

      • elementsInLevelOrder

        public java.lang.String elementsInLevelOrder()
        Returns a string of all the elements in the tree through level order traversal. This method is used to help see the shape and contents of the 2 3 tree implementation. Note that the level-order traversal algorithm is referenced from the CSC316 Tree lecture slides on page 22, provided by Jason King.
        Returns:
        the string representation of all the elements in the tree
